Sofa Similarity Search
  • Sofa Similarity Search Documentation
  • View page source

Sofa Similarity Search Documentation

Welcome to the Sofa Similarity Search documentation. This application helps users find similar sofas based on image comparison using computer vision techniques.

Core Components

Main Application

class app.main.SofaSimilarityApp(preprocessor_service: IPreprocessorService, similarity_service: ISimilarityService)[source]

Bases: object

Main application class for Sofa Similarity Search.

__init__(preprocessor_service: IPreprocessorService, similarity_service: ISimilarityService)[source]

Initialize the application with required services.

Parameters:

  • preprocessor_service – Service for preprocessing images

  • similarity_service – Service for finding similar sofas

display_similar_product(product: Product, similarity: float, col1: Any, col2: Any) → None[source]

Display the similar product information in the UI.

Parameters:

  • product – Product to display

  • similarity – Similarity score

  • col1 – First column for image

  • col2 – Second column for details

find_similar_sofa(image: ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray | None, Tuple[Product, float] | None][source]

Process an image and find similar sofas.

Parameters:

image – Input image in BGR format

Returns:

Tuple of (processed_image, (similar_product, similarity_score))

run() → None[source]

Run the Streamlit application.

app.main.init_services() → Tuple[IPreprocessorService, ISimilarityService][source]

Initialize application services.

Returns:

Tuple of (preprocessor_service, similarity_service)

app.main.main() → None[source]

Main entry point of the application.

class src.preprocessor.main.SofaSegmenter(padding: int = 10, max_size: int = 800, iterations: int = 1)[source]

Bases: IPreprocessor

Sofa segmentation and background removal using GrabCut algorithm.

__init__(padding: int = 10, max_size: int = 800, iterations: int = 1)[source]

Initialize the sofa segmenter.

Parameters:

  • padding (int) – Padding to add around the segmented sofa

  • max_size (int) – Maximum dimension size for resizing while maintaining aspect ratio

  • iterations (int) – Number of GrabCut iterations

Raises:

ValueError – If any parameters are invalid

_create_initial_mask(height: int, width: int) → ndarray[source]

Create initial mask for GrabCut with sofa-specific regions.

Parameters:

  • height (int) – Image height

  • width (int) – Image width

Returns:

Initialized mask with background/foreground regions

Return type:

np.ndarray

_get_bounding_box(mask: ndarray) → Tuple[int, int, int, int][source]

Get bounding box coordinates from the largest contour in the mask.

Parameters:

mask – Binary mask

Returns:

(x, y, width, height) of bounding box

Return type:

Tuple[int, int, int, int]

_resize_image(image: ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray, float][source]

Resize image while maintaining aspect ratio if it exceeds max_size.

Parameters:

image – Input image

Returns:

(Resized image, scale factor)

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, float]

Raises:

ValueError – If input image is empty or invalid

_segment_sofa(image: ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray, BoundingBox][source]

Segment sofa from image using GrabCut algorithm.

Parameters:

image – Input BGR image

Returns:

(Segmented image, bounding box)

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, BoundingBox]

Raises:

  • Exception – If segmentation fails

  • ValueError – If input image is invalid

preprocess(image: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Preprocess sofa image using GrabCut-based segmentation.

Parameters:

image – Input BGR image

Returns:

Processed image with background removed and cropped

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

Exception – If critical processing error occurs

Feature Extraction

Bases: IFeatureExtractor

Color Histogram and Texture feature extractor implementation.

Initialize the Color Histogram extractor.

Parameters:

hist_bins (int) – Number of bins for the color histogram

Raises:

ValueError – If hist_bins is less than or equal to 0

_compute_glcm(gray_image: ndarray, distances=[1], angles=[0, 0.7853981633974483, 1.5707963267948966, 2.356194490192345]) → ndarray[source]

Compute Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix.

Parameters:

  • gray_image – Grayscale image

  • distances – List of pixel pair distances

  • angles – List of pixel pair angles

Returns:

GLCM matrix

_compute_glcm_features(glcm: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Compute features from GLCM.

Parameters:

glcm – Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix

Returns:

Array of GLCM features

_compute_pair_similarity(features1: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray], features2: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]) → float[source]

Compute similarity between two feature sets.

Parameters:

  • features1 – Tuple of (color_hist1, texture_features1)

  • features2 – Tuple of (color_hist2, texture_features2)

Returns:

Similarity score between 0 and 1

Return type:

float

Raises:

  • ValueError – If features are invalid or incompatible

  • TypeError – If features are not tuples

_cosine_similarity(v1: ndarray, v2: ndarray) → float[source]

Calculate cosine similarity between two vectors.

Parameters:

  • v1 – First vector

  • v2 – Second vector

Returns:

Cosine similarity

Return type:

float

Raises:

  • ValueError – If vectors have different shapes or are empty

  • TypeError – If inputs are not numpy arrays

compute_similarity_matrix(features_list: List[Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]]) → ndarray[source]

Compute pairwise similarity matrix between all feature pairs.

Parameters:

features_list – List of feature tuples, each containing (color_hist, texture_features)

Returns:

Similarity matrix

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

  • ValueError – If features_list is empty or contains invalid features

  • TypeError – If features_list is not a list

extract_features(image: ndarray) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray][source]

Extract color histogram and texture features from an image.

Parameters:

image (np.ndarray) – Input image as a numpy array (BGR format)

Returns:

(keypoints, descriptors)

  • keypoints: Color histogram features

  • descriptors: Texture features

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

  • ValueError – If image is None, empty, or not a valid numpy array

  • TypeError – If image is not a numpy array

find_most_similar(query_features: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray], database_features: List[Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]]) → Tuple[int, float][source]

Find the most similar features from a database of features.

Parameters:

  • query_features – Tuple of (color_hist, texture_features) for query image

  • database_features – List of feature tuples for database images

Returns:

(index, similarity_score)

  • index: Index of most similar features in database_features

  • similarity_score: Similarity score of the best match

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

  • ValueError – If database_features is empty or features are invalid

  • TypeError – If inputs are of incorrect type
